page.title: 08PORCHFIELD FACTS AND FIGURES
page.content: Porchfield is a small village on the Isle of Wight.The population consists of: 11 children 0_4 years 13 children 5-9 years 30 children 10-14 years 195 males 165 females Total population 360 in 136 dwellings. There is a cricket club,shop and post office,youth club and Womens Institute hall.A member has painted the W.I. walls showing Porchfield Memorial and Newtown Church.The village folk have a tin bath race annually and a collection is made for the Cancer relief charity.There is no village school so a school bus takes the children to schools nearby.The Post Office run a daily Post-bus service enabling villagers to visit the town of Newport.
